channel.title: The Linux Filesystem - David Vargas
channel.description: Filesystem Hierarchy $ ls -l / / - The root directory of the entire filesystem hierarchy, everything is nested under this directory. /bin - Essential ready-to-run programs (binaries), includes the most basic commands such as ls and cp. /boot - Contains kernal boot loader files. /dev - Device files. /etc - Core system configuration directory, should hold only configuration files and not any binaries. /home - Personal directories for users
